title: Oracle BPM Training
description: Mindmajix Oracle BPM training is designed to develop the core skills and competence in building Oracle Business Process Management Suite solutions with practical sessions. You’ll gain in-depth knowledge on BPMN process modeling, business rules, human workflow, adaptive case management, etc., through hands-on projects. Upon completion, you’ll be able to implement this knowledge in real-time. Enroll now and get certified.
what_will_learn: |LEAN business processes|ProPeC "Simple Improvement Process"|Connect business improvements to high-level business goals|Current state analysis|Identify and implement an action plan|Create a process flow and implement a continuous improvement strategy|Run an efficient business meeting|
prerequisites:
What are the prerequisites for the Oracle BPM course?




The following are the prerequisites for learning Oracle BPM course:
Basic knowledge of,

Oracle service bus
Oracle SOA
Oracle BPEL
DevOps

title: IBM BPM Training
description: Mindmajix’s IBM BPM (Business Process Manager) Training provides insights into business process management with practical examples. The course starts with an overview of BPM, emphasizing concepts of re-use, maintenance, and high development strategies. You’ll learn to create business objects, variables, implement gateways, and more. Hands-on exercises throughout the course provide experience with BPM tasks and skills.
what_will_learn: |Get an overview of the IBM Business Process Manager architecture, and its components|Use the Process Designer to Create ad hoc activities|Create a process application using process designer|Build a business data model|Translate workflow steps into business process activities and nested processes|Manage variables and dataflow|Master performance concepts and methodologies|Initialize Complex variable using Javascript|Implement Ajax controls on a Coach|Create efficient Coaches and Coach Views|

The participant should have a basic knowledge of data structures and web services.
The participant should have a basic understanding of SQL and Javascript.
